New Records: Saturday tied a Blue Jays franchise record for largest shutout win.
Toronto set season highs for both runs (15) and hits (23).
Will Wagner finished the game with five hits, the first rookie in Blue Jays history to do so.
Key Match Events: Daulton Varsho and Spencer Horwitz each hit two-run home runs in the first inning.
Addison Barger hit a two-run home run in the second inning.
José Berríos tossed six shutout innings, allowing just three hits and striking out five.
Will Wagner added a solo homer for Toronto.
Twins infielder Kyle Farmer pitched the eighth and ninth innings, allowing three runs.
Post-Match Reflections: José Berríos mentioned he was under the weather and had a fever but still performed well.
Berríos expressed his commitment to helping his team despite the challenge.
Zebby Matthews expressed frustration over his performance, stating his job is to give the team the best chance to win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Blue Jays manager John Schneider mentioned that Berríos was under the weather.
Twins CF Manny Margot exited the game with right groin tightness and will undergo an MRI.
